abstracts.cdata!:
Among the main targets of the Health
            Insurance Project, indigenous peoples and ethnic minorities
            stand as important beneficiaries of the project, and, it is
            to this end, this Indigenous Peoples Plan (IPP) seeks to
            ensure compliance and accountability, through
            recommendations as follows. Health care services providers
            shall be provided adequate training, to include
            intercultural health care services networks, along with
            ambulatory services as may be required. The Ministry of
            Health services shall be integrated with traditional
            medicine networks in the micro-regions, in addition to local
            sites. Participatory approaches shall include
            representatives of both government and indigenous
            organizations, to promote the intercultural health care,
            through social assistance services. Research, and monitoring
            will be conducted on existing traditional medicine
            practices, their access and use, consistent with health care
            services provided. Communication awareness and promotion
            campaigns will be conducted, as will participatory
            monitoring of local organizations, to meet regularly and
            discuss the quality of service, and beneficiary
            satisfaction. Evaluation and grievance mechanisms will be in
            place to ensure compliance with these regulations.
